title: rustc keeps suggesting borrows to no avail

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

Don't have a minimum reproduction case because I don't fully understand the issue yet

see repo [here](https://github.com/drewcassidy/generic-parameterize/tree/rustc-wtf) specifically [these lines](https://github.com/drewcassidy/generic-parameterize/blob/rustc-wtf/src/lib.rs#L260-L263)


```Rust

// it keeps wanting me to add more borrows!
    &(&param_lists
        .iter()
        .map(|pl| zip(repeat(pl.0.clone()), pl.1.params()))
        .multi_cartesian_product());
```


### Current output

```Shell
error[E0277]: the trait bound `std::boxed::Box<dyn Iterator<Item = &dyn params::Param>>: Clone` is not satisfied
    --> src/lib.rs:263:10
     |
263  |         .multi_cartesian_product());
     |          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `Clone` is not implemented for `std::boxed::Box<dyn Iterator<Item = &dyn params::Param>>`
     |
     = note: required for `std::boxed::Box<dyn Iterator<Item = &dyn params::Param>>` to implement `Clone`
     = note: 1 redundant requirement hidden
     = note: required for `std::iter::Zip<std::iter::Repeat<proc_macro2::Ident>, std::boxed::Box<dyn Iterator<Item = &dyn params::Param>>>` to implement `Clone`
note: required by a bound in `multi_cartesian_product`
    --> /Users/drewcassidy/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/itertools-0.10.5/src/lib.rs:1116:55
     |
1116 |               <Self::Item as IntoIterator>::IntoIter: Clone,
     |                                                       ^^^^^ required by this bound in `Itertools::multi_cartesian_product`
help: consider borrowing here
     |
260  ~     &(&(&param_lists
261  |         .iter()
262  ~         .map(|pl| zip(repeat(pl.0.clone()), pl.1.params())))
     |
```


### Desired output


Im not sure the correct solution here, but it keeps suggesting I borrow something already borrowed and it changes nothing



### Rationale and extra context

_No response_

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

Nightly shows the same output
